snippet: The Los Angeles City Council voted, 13 to 1, on Wednesday to raise the minimum wage in the city to $15 an hour by 2020, but a second vote is required for final approval because the vote was not unanimous.
abstract: Los Angeles City Council votes, 13 to 1, to raise minimum wage in the city to $15 an hour by 2020; second vote is required for final approval.
lead_paragraph: The Los Angeles City Council voted, 13 to 1, on Wednesday to raise the minimum wage in the city to $15 an hour by 2020, but a second vote is required for final approval because the vote was not unanimous.

headline.main: California: $15 Minimum Wage Is Now a Step Closer in Los Angeles
headline.print_headline: California: $15 Minimum Wage Is Now a Step Closer in Los Angeles
